name: places/ChIJP4vsqZlZwokRRbxVDWt84pQ
adrFormatAddress: 150 5th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text:
This review is about the store's restroom policy, not the store's collection or staff. I recently visited the store and bought a dress. During checkout I realized I needed to (somewhat urgently) use the restroom and requested the cashier for access to a restroom. I was denied access and told that they didn't have a "public restroom". While I can understand why a store may not want to provide public access to their restroom, to deny a (paying) customer who requests urgent access is inhumane and unprofessional. This isn't a store that values its customers.
(I had a harrowing ordeal trying to find a restroom after being denied at Ganni and narrowly avoided having an accident.)

originalText.text: The staff at this location was very kind! While I predominately shop online, I was enthusiastic to unexpectedly pass a Ganni location, so my partner and I headed in to browse -- that is, get a sense of materials, texture, etc. Not planning a larger purchase that day, I only bought a scrunchie as a holiday gift; the salesperson was kind enough to offer a dustbag as an alternative to boxes when we inquired! They were polite, friendly, and gave us space to browse but were available if needed. They also assured this is the location in the city I'll be favouring with future purchases, potentially more than online! Gannigirls

originalText.text: Georgia and Jackie provided the BEST customer service I could have asked for. I will go out of my way to shop at the Flatiron Ganni from now on. Thank you both for being so understanding with my exchange!

originalText.text: Really great customer service! I would 10/10 recommend this store. Dana is super sweet and helpful as well :)

text.text: Really great customer service! I would 10/10 recommend this store. Dana is super sweet and helpful as well :)
